page.title: 14Wool C of E School:Class 4.
page.content: The school bell rings at 8.55 a.m (It is the original school bell of 1871) If you are late you can hear it ringing, so you walk a little faster. We line up in the playground then walk into school, class by class.The teacher marks the register.We go straight into assembly.The Reverend John Goodman, Rector of Wool, takes class 4 for Religious Education.It is now 9.45 a.m. We have a discussion and then write a story.10.40 a.m. Time for break. 10.55 a.m.Some of us use the calculator, others work on the computer. 12.00 Time for lunch.Meals are no longer cooked so we eat sandwiches which we have brought from home. 1.15.We type in pages on the computer for the Domesday project. 2.45.We read a story quietly. 3.15.Time to go home. The day is over.
